channel.title: Allergy to bud?
channel.description:
Yesterday I had an allergic reaction to something, which I am assuming is the bud I smoked. About 3 people shared the first joint we smoked, and it went normally.
About 30min after I was a bit spaced out, and then realised that I couldn't feel anything inside my mouth. My gums were numb, as if they were numbed at a dentist, and the same with my tongue. I had no idea what was happening, so I decided to try drink & eat, which made no difference. Other symptoms were that my lounge had green / brown stains on it, when the numbness first came about.
I went to a&e, as i thought it could of been something serious, but 30min after taking an allergy tablet they gave me, the numbness & swelling went down.
We've been smoking the same weed, from the same dealer various times this week & the week before.
tl;dr- Mouth went completely numb after smoking a J, went to hospitable where they told me it was an allergic reaction. Has this happened to anyone else before? As I'm unsure about whether to smoke it again.

item.title: Allergy to bud?
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

Kaza:

I’ve been told that the dealer we used last time sprays his bud in something, to make it weigh more. The person who told me said her group of friends all got headaches and said they felt like shit after smoking it.

Sand and glass here…

Read full topic

I’ve been told that the dealer we used last time sprays his bud in something, to make it weigh more. The person who told me said her group of friends all got headaches and said they felt like shit after smoking it.

item.title: Allergy to bud?
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Archer:

If you are allergic, would you not have experienced these symptoms the first time smoking it? It could have been laced.

Seems I’m retarded for thinking that.

  • Isn’t it possible to develop allergies? When having no side-effects before?

Read full topic
